Here's what you need to know:
Persistence mode makes the window reappear after the screen turns back on. Otherwise, the X-Ray Display window is removed when your screen turns off.

Horizontal and Vertical offsets move the window on the respective axes, and Gravity determines where the base window is placed.

Transparency determines if the X-Ray Display window can be seen through. Lower compression levels make the images appear faster, transparency level controls how visible the window is.

It is highly recommended to make the window resolution around one-quarter the size of your device's screen.
